applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the operation of a company pension death benefit scheme. It is not related to SME lending or relevant activities as defined in the regulation. 2) The document is specifically about an insurance/pension product offered by AIB Life, not lending activities. 3) The scheme described is an occupational pension scheme governed by the Pensions Act and Revenue requirements, not SME lending regulations. 4) The document's purpose and content are focused on providing death benefits for scheme members' dependants, which falls outside the scope of SME lending activities referenced in Regulation 8. 5) The regulated entity (AIB Life) is operating as an insurance/pension provider in this context, not as a lender to SMEs.
regulation_title: Restricted application in respect of relevant activities related to SMEs
regulation_text: 8. Chapter 12 of Part 2, and Regulation 115(1)(m) do not apply to the extent that the complaint is in relation to one or more "relevant activities" within the meaning of that term in Regulation 2 of the Central Bank (Supervision and Enforcement) Act 2013 (Sec tion 48) (Lending to Small and Medium -Sized Enterprises) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 585 of 2015).
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
